headline: The Ukrainian family torn by war and exile behind a famous photo published by Le Monde
description: A few days after the Russian invasion, photojournalist Laurence Geai captured the farewell of a Ukrainian family at Odesa train station. Four years later, the mother welcomed Le Monde to Cologne, Germany, where she lives as a refugee with her son and her mother, far from her husband, since enlisted in the army.

headline: Secret Service kills man trying to enter Trump's Mar-a-Lago estate
Top Mexican drug cartel leader killed
Iran-US talks expected Thursday despite fears of strikes
description: Iran's Foreign Minister Abbas Araghchi said on Sunday that details of a possible deal to forestall fresh conflict were being drawn up ahead of Thursday's renewed talks on Tehran's nuclear program.

headline: India, world's leading dairy producer, struggles to rid market of adulterated milk
description: Water is often added to Indian milk, but so are chemicals and vegetable oils. The quality of Indian dairy is frequently questionable – a fact highlighted by a recent scandal in the state of Gujarat.

headline: Is it ever a good idea to... wear artificially distressed clothing?
description: In fashion, as in life, it is important to know the lines you should not cross. Or else, to do so deliberately.

headline: AI has arrived in France's local elections – for better or worse
description: From creating campaign videos to writing speeches, artificial intelligence has become an effective tool for candidates. However, it also raises ethical questions, prompting some elected officials to call for regulation.

Karyna Shuliak was Jeffrey Epstein's last partner and main heiress. She won't benefit from his will
description: The Belarusian woman met the sexual predator when she was 20 and remained loyal to him until his suicide in prison in 2019.

headline: Documents show Epstein's attempts at connecting with Sarkozy's circle
description: Nicolas Princen, an adviser to Nicolas Sarkozy at the Elysée Palace, met the sex offender in his Paris apartment in 2011. The meeting, which 'had no follow-up,' according to Princen, illustrates Epstein's attempts to approach the French presidency under Sarkozy.

headline: How a messianic movement is changing the Israeli military
description: Followers of the Hardal movement, a blend of religious fundamentalism and ultranationalism, have begun to make inroads into the military establishment. Their dehumanizing rhetoric toward Palestinians has contributed to the destruction of the Gaza Strip.
